events.name: ADVANCED R TRAINING by Jared Lander
events.description: The Revolution Analytics’ Center of Excellence (COE) is a collaboration with the Infocomm Development Authority of Singapore (IDA) to enable Singapore companies and professionals with training and expertise for big data analytics projects. We are pleased to host Professor Lander in Singapore from 2nd to 6th Feb 2015 for public class trainings and workshops. Jared P. Lander is a long-time Revolution Analytics consultant and collaborator, and the Founder and CEO of Lander Analytics. He is also the Organizer of the New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup and an Adjunct Professor of Statistics at Columbia University. With a masters from Columbia University in statistics and a bachelors from Muhlenberg College in mathematics, he has experience in both academic research and industry. He specializes in data management, multilevel models, machine learning, generalized linear models, data management, visualization and statistical computing. He is the author of R for Everyone, a book about R Programming geared toward Data Scientists and Non-Statisticians alike. The book is available from Amazon , Barnes & Noble and InformIT . The material is drawn from the classes he teaches at Columbia and is incorporated into his corporate training. Very active in the data community, Jared is a frequent speaker at conferences, universities and meetups around the world. He was a member of the 2014 Strata New York selection committee.
events.location: Revolution Analytics Singapore Office, 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 #04-09/10

events.name: A confident speaker: a proven communications programme (open to public)
events.description:
A proven platform for members to learn to speak to their colleagues, their clients and superiors with ease, confidence and impact. 
  
Guests are welcome to join our meetings at no cost, and to experience the below tried and proven activities that has benefited our members for the past 90 years: 
1) Speeches by members 
This is the time for members to improve their communication skills before an audience. Members are encouraged to speak and not afraid of making "mistakes", as this is a place where all learn while having fun. In this way, our members will be able to raise their standards as a confident speaker, step by step, at their own comfortable pace. 
  
2) Evaluate to motivate 
Experienced toastmasters will give feedback to the speakers. They will highlight their strengths, as well as their areas of improvements. This segment is to motivate the speakers to perform better in their future speeches. 
  
3) Special workshop 
Speaker: Crispin Rodrigues, DTM 
Besides being a university lecturer, Crispin is also a poet, actor, playwright and emcee. He also displayed his talents in his writing skills as the editor-in-chief at "The Eloquent Orifice", a Singapore based literary and cultural e-magazine. On top of his commitments, he volunteered his time by taking on a senior volunteer leader, overseeing over 20 Toastmasters clubs. 
  
Dress code: Office attire or casual wear (No shorts or slippers)
events.location: Oo La Laa Cafe and Bistro, 2 Marne Rd, Singapore 208393
